alert.note: Alert for Central Somerset (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 07 at 2:18PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Somerset County through 245 PM EDT... At 217 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 11 miles west of Seboomook, or 25 miles northeast of Jackman, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. Heavy downpours. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Seboomook, Pittston Academy Grant, Plymouth, Comstock and Hammond. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until this storm passes.
